h1: How Many Calories in a Shot of Bourbon?
assumptions: Standard 1.5 oz (44 ml) serving of 80-proof (40% ABV) bourbon whiskey, straight—no mixers or ice.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, proof, serving size, and any additions like mixers; alcohol content affects calories. Consult labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard shot of 80-proof bourbon contains about 97 calories, all from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

Use 1 oz shot instead of 1.5 oz

faqs.q: How many calories in a shot of bourbon?
faqs.a: Approximately 97 calories for a standard 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof bourbon.

faqs.q: Does bourbon have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: Straight bourbon has 0 g carbs and 0 g sugars; calories come solely from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in bourbon?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more alcohol and calories—e.g., 100-proof adds about 22 kcal per shot.

faqs.q: Are there any nutrients besides calories in bourbon?
faqs.a: No protein, fat, fiber, or significant vitamins; it's essentially empty calories from ethanol.

faqs.q: What about calories in bourbon on the rocks?
faqs.a: Ice dilutes slightly but doesn't change calories much; still ~97 kcal for the bourbon portion.
